Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis; interior: glazed black with band in added red near top of sherd and a pair lower down on bowl; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of two animal friezes separated by simple line; upper frieze: paws of possible feline, to left; lower frieze: body and three legs of deer or goat grazing to left (red on neck, chest, top of shoulder, belly and haunch); below, band of staggered dots between treble dilute brown lines; tip of one rising ray projecting upwards from bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Athens NM 296, which is a lekanis attributed to the KX Painter (ABV, 24, no. 7; Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, fig. 19).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.4)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 333, no. B386)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 147)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0770) (Phase 1)
